H0.text: Natural selection is the process by which animals with better fitness have a better chance of passing their genes onto the next generation.

H1.text: Survival selection is the process by which animals with better fitness have a better chance of passing their genes onto the next generation.

H2.text: Natural evolution is the process by which animals with better fitness have a better chance of passing their genes onto the next generation.

H3.text: Fitness selection is the process by which animals with better fitness have a better chance of passing their genes onto the next generation.

A4.text: Natural selection is the differential survival and reproduction of individuals due to differences in the relative fitness endowed on them by their own particular complement of observable characteristics.

A5.text: If an organism lives half as long as others of its species, but has twice as many offspring surviving to adulthood, its genes become more common in the adult population of the next generation.
